intro: Cycloloma atriplicifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf cycloloma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive trifoliate structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cycloloma atriplicifolium thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its ecological significance includes providing forage for wildlife and contributing to soil stabilization in its native range.
